task_description: Facing the building to your West (approx. 278Â°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to estimate the height of the building in front of me, but I can't see the top, so I will tilt my view upwards to see the entire structure.

Now that I can see the entire building from the ground to the roof, I can estimate its height by counting the floors and multiplying by an average floor height; I count approximately 7 floors, and assuming each floor is about 3.5 meters, the total height is around 24.5 meters.
